content.question:
The table below shows a production function for a firm.

All of the following can be concluded from the information in the table EXCEPT:

choices.label: Diminishing marginal returns set in after the fourth unit of the variable input.
Marginal product is positive if total product is increasing.
This is a production function for a perfectly competitive firm.
A profit-maximizing firm would never voluntarily employ the eighth unit of the variable input.
Total product starts to decrease when marginal product changes from positive to negative.

content.answer: This is a production function for a perfectly competitive firm.

unit.text: 3: Production, Cost, and the Perfect Competition Model
